text: Ronald Greenwald (January 8, 1934 â€“ January 20, 2016) was an American Orthodox Jewish rabbi. He was a businessman and an educator. He was born in New York City. == Career == Greenwald made a career of spy trading, international hostage mediation, and other forms of high-stakes diplomacy. He worked with Presidents Richard Nixon, Gerald Ford and Ronald Reagan to help the Jewish community. He served as a community activist, chaired various civic boards, directed a high school a summer camp and was the chairman of Magenu. Greenwald died in his sleep while on vacation in Florida from a possible heart attack on January 20, 2016 at the age of 82. ==References== ==Other websites== * * .
